places.title: Zhangye Danxia landform
places.description: The rainbow formation is the result of red sandstone and mineral deposits being laid down for over 24 million years, according to the Telegraph.

places.title: The Great Blue Hole
places.description: The Great Blue Hole is a submarine sinkhole off the coast of Belize. It’s one of the top scuba diving sites in the world and the water is more than 400 feet deep.

places.title: Tulip fields
places.description: Many people often mistake Keukenhof, also known as the Garden of Europe, as the designated space of the tulip fields. However, these majestic fields are located just outside the garden and are mostly privately owned.

places.title: The Hang Son Doong cave
places.description: Son Doong is the world’s largest cave, created 2–5 million years ago. A half-mile block of 40-story buildings could fit inside it!

places.title: Hitachi Seaside Park
places.description: The park is in full bloom during spring and tourists often visit to see 4.5 million “baby blue-eyes” flowers blossom.

places.title: Mendenhall Ice Caves
places.description: The cave lies beneath the Mendenhall Glacier and it melts as you walk through it.

places.title: Victoria Falls
places.description: This 354-foot waterfall lies at the border of Zambia and Zimbabwe and it is the widest waterfall in Africa. There’s also a famous feature on the Zambian side called the Devil’s Pool, which allows adventurous tourists to hang out at the edge of the falls.

places.title: Mount Roraima
places.description: The incredible tabletop mountains are some of the oldest geological formations on the planet, dating back about 2 billion years ago. This was also part of the inspiration for Paradise Falls in Disney’s UP.

places.title: Beachy Escapes
places.description: Of the hundreds and hundreds of new hotel openings around the world in 2014, we've chosen our 101 most interesting.

places.title: Travel Bucket List: 10 Trips That Are Insanely Romantic
places.description: Whether you're in a serious relationship or just taking full advantage of Cuffing Season, a getaway for two sounds pretty good right about now. Doesn't it?

places.title: The Ultimate Island Retreat: Yemaya Island Hideway, Nicaragua
places.description: Only 43 miles off the eastern coast of Nicaragua, on virtually untouched Little Corn Island, 16 beautifully designed cabanas all have direct access to beach and hammocks.

places.title: Cape Weligama Resort: The Best of Sri Lanka
places.description: oving east across the Indian Ocean to Sri Lanka, Cape Weligama represents the best of best of new about this island's full recovery from the 2004 tsunami.

places.title: Rooms with Views: X2 River Kwai, Thailand
places.description: Each room of this contemporary, 8-room designer enclave features panoramic views of the Kwai Noi River beneath a stunning, serene backdrop of mountain ranges and countryside.

places.title: The best city for book lovers
places.description: To honor one the author and his sacrifices, admirers celebrate Dostoyevsky Day in St. Petersburg. Held the first Saturday of every July, fans gather across the city to celebrate their hero.

places.title: Explore Serengeti
places.description: The Serengeti hosts the largest terrestrial mammal migration in the world, which helps secure it as one of the Seven Natural Wonders of Africa and one of the ten natural travel wonders of the world.
